column4: hello, i'm trying to set up "monodevelop" on my ubuntu machine, it's hitting an impossible dependency... "monodevelop: Depends: monodoc-base (< 1.1.6) but1.1.13-0ubuntu1 is to be installed - E: Broken packages".... i tried googling but could not find any relevant information..... any ideas?
did you installing the mono-base first?
sudo apt-get install mono-base before trying to install via sudo apt-get install mono-develop
E: Couldn't find package mono-base
do apt-cache search mono and see if you see it there, if you don't, you don't have the correct repos yet
not sure, i'm using kernel 2.6.15-25-386
read the information about multiverse
the only mono-base i see using apt-cache search mono is mono-assembiles-base
ok, then you don't have the right repos yet
do you have the multiverse enabled
i'm about 95% sure i enabled the universe repo, and still no "mono-base" however i managed to get monodevelop installed, but it crashes on startup
copy your sources.list to the pastebin and let me see it
does that make sense?
yes, here it is http://pastebin.com/pastebin.php?show=711764
is it called mono-common maybe?
you need the backports
okay, trying now, just a sec
see if that works, i think thats where the stuff is
did that work
try sudo apt-get install mono
you may not even need the backports
